txt: In all, says Mr. W.L. McAtee, thirty-six species of birds of thirteen
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: families help man in his irrepressible conflict against his deadly
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: enemy, the codling moth. "In some places they destroy from sixty-six to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: eighty-five per cent of the hibernating larvae."
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Now, are the farmers of this country content to let the Italians of the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: North, and the negroes of the South, shoot those birds for food, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: devour them? What is the great American farmer going to _do_ about this
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: matter? What he should do is to write and urge his members of Congress
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to work for and vote for the federal migratory bird bill.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE COTTON BOLL WEEVIL.--Let us take one other concrete case. The cotton
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: boll weevil invaded the United States from Mexico in 1894. Ten years
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: later it was costing the cotton planters an annual loss estimated at
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: fifteen million dollars per year. Later on that loss was estimated at
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: twenty million dollars. The cotton boll weevil strikes at the heart of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the industry by destroying the boll of the cotton plant. While the total
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: loss never can be definitely ascertained, we know that it has amounted
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to many millions of dollars. The figure given above has been widely
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: quoted, and so far as I am aware, never disputed.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Fortunately we have at hand a government publication on this subject
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: which gives some pertinent facts regarding the bird enemies of the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cotton boll weevil. It is Circular No. 57 of the Biological Survey,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Department of Agriculture. Any one can obtain it by addressing that
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Department. I quote the most important portions of this valuable
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: document:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: BIRDS USEFUL IN THE WAR AGAINST THE COTTON BOLL WEEVIL.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: By H.W. Henshaw, Chief of the Biological Survey.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The main purpose of this circular is to direct the attention of cotton
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: growers and others in the cotton growing states to the importance of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: birds in the boll weevil war, to emphasize the need of protection for
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: them, and to suggest means to increase the numbers and extend the range
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of certain of the more important kinds.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Investigations by the Biological Survey show that thirty-eight species
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of birds eat boll weevils. While some eat them only sparingly others eat
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: them freely, and no fewer than forty-seven adult weevils have been found
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: in the stomach of a single cliff swallow. Of the birds known at the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: present time to feed on the weevil, among the most important are the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: orioles, nighthawks, and, foremost of all, the swallows (including the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: purple martin).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: ORIOLES.--Six kinds of orioles live in Texas, though but two inhabit the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: southern states generally. Orioles are among the few birds that evince a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: decided preference for weevils, and as they persistently hunt for the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: insects on the bolls, they fill a place occupied by no other birds. They
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: are protected by law in nearly every state in the Union, but their
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: bright plumage renders them among the most salable of birds for
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: millinery purposes, and despite protective laws, considerable numbers
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: are still killed for the hat trade. It is hardly necessary to point out
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: that their importance as insect eaters everywhere demands their
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: protection, but more especially in the cotton belt.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: NIGHTHAWK.--The nighthawk, or bull-bat, also renders important service
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: in the destruction of weevils, and catches them on the wing in
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: considerable numbers, especially during its migration. Unfortunately,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: _the nighthawk is eaten for food in some sections of the South, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: considerable numbers are shot for this purpose_. The bird's value for
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: food, however, is infinitesimal as compared with the service it renders
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the cotton grower and other agriculturists, and every effort should be
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: made to spread broadcast a knowledge of its usefulness as a weevil
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: destroyer, with a view to its complete protection.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: SWALLOWS.--Of all the birds now known to destroy weevils, swallows are
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the most important. Six species occur in Texas and the southern states.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The martin, the barn swallow, the bank swallow, the roughwing, and the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cliff swallow breed locally in Texas, and all of them, except the cliff
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: swallow, breed in the other cotton states. The white-bellied, or tree
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: swallow, nests only in the North, and by far the greater number of cliff
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: swallows nest in the North and West.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: [Illustration: THE BALTIMORE ORIOLE
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The Deadly Enemy of the Cotton-Boll Weevil
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: From the "American Natural History"]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: As showing how a colony of martins thrives when provided with sufficient
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: room to multiply, an experiment by Mr. J. Warren Jacobs, of Waynesburg,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Pa., may be cited. The first year five pairs were induced to occupy the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: single box provided, and raised eleven young. The fourth year three
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: large boxes, divided into ninety-nine rooms, contained fifty-three
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: pairs, and they raised about 175 young. The colony was thus nearly three
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: hundred strong at the close of the fourth season. The effect of this
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: number of hungry martins on the insects infesting the neighborhood may
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: be imagined.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: From the standpoint of the farmer and the cotton grower, swallows are
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: among the most useful birds. Especially designed by nature to capture
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: insects in midair, their powers of flight and endurance are unexcelled,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and in their own field they have no competitors. Their peculiar value to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the cotton grower consists in the fact that, like the nighthawk, they
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: capture boll weevils when flying over the fields, which no other birds
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: do. Flycatchers snap up the weevils near trees and shrubbery. Wrens hunt
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: them out when concealed under bark or rubbish. Blackbirds catch them on
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the ground, as do the killdeer, titlark, meadow lark, and others; while
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: orioles hunt for them on the bolls. But it is the peculiar function of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: swallows to catch the weevils as they are making long flights, leaving
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the cotton fields in search of hiding places in which to winter or
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: entering them to continue their work of devastation.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Means have been taken to inform residents of the northern states of the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: value of the swallow tribe to agriculturists generally, and particularly
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to cotton planters, in the belief that the number of swallows breeding
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: in the North can be substantially increased. The cooperation of the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: northern states is important, since birds bred in the North migrate
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: directly through the southern states in the fall on their way to the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: distant tropics, and also in the spring on their return.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: [Illustration: THE NIGHTHAWK
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: A Goatsucker, not a Song-bird; but it Feeds Exclusively Upon Insects]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Important as it is to increase the number of northern breeding swallows,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: it is still more important to increase the number nesting in the South
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and to induce the birds there to extend their range over as much of the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cotton area as possible. Nesting birds spend much more time in the South
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: than migrants, and during the weeks when the old birds are feeding young
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: they are almost incessantly engaged in the pursuit of insects.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: It is not, of course, claimed that birds alone can stay the ravages of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the cotton boll weevil in Texas, but they materially aid in checking the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: advance of the pest into the other cotton states. Important auxiliaries,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: in destroying these insects, birds aid in reducing their numbers within
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: safe limits, and once within safe limits in keeping them there. Hence it
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: is for the interests of the cotton states that special efforts be made
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to protect and care for the weevil-eating species, and to increase their
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: numbers in every way possible.--(End of the circular.)
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: CONDENSED NOTES ON THE FOOD HABITS OF CERTAIN NORTH AMERICAN BIRDS.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Millions of Americans and near-Americans, both old and young, now need
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to be shown the actual figures that represent the value of our birds as
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: destroyers of the insects, weeds and the small rodents that are swarming
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to overrun and devour our fields, orchards and forests. Will our people
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: never learn that in fighting pests the birds are worth ten times more to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: men than all the poisons, sprays and traps that ever were invented or
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: used?
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: We cannot spray our forests; and if the wild birds do not protect, them
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: from insects, _nothing will_! If you will watch a warbler collecting the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: insects out of the top of a seventy-foot forest oak, busy as a bee hour
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: after hour, it will convince you that the birds do for the forests that
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: which man with all his resources cannot accomplish. You will then
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: realize that to this country every woodpecker, chickadee, titmouse,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: creeper and warbler is easily worth its weight in gold. The killing of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: any member of those groups of birds should be punished by a fine of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: twenty-five dollars.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: [Illustration: THE PURPLE MARTIN
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: A Representative of the Swallow Family. A Great Insect-eater;
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: one of the Most Valuable of all Birds to the Southern Cotton
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: planter, and Northern farmer. Shot for "Food" in the South.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Driven out of the North by the English Sparrow Pest.]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE BOB-WHITE.--And take the _Bob White Quail_, for example, and the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: weeds of the farm. To kill weeds costs money--hard cash that the farmer
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: earns by toil. Does the farmer put forth strenuous efforts to protect
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the bird of all birds that does most to help him keep down the weeds?
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Far from it! All that the _average_ farmer thinks about the quail is of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: killing it, for a few ounces of meat on the table.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: It is fairly beyond question that of all birds that influence the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: fortunes of the farmers and fruit-growers of North America, the common
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: quail, or bob white, is one of the most valuable. It stays on the farm
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: all the year round. When insects are most numerous and busy, Bob White
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: devotes to them his entire time. He cheerfully fights them, from sixteen
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to eighteen hours per day. When the insects are gone, he turns his
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: attention to the weeds that are striving to seed down the fields for
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: another year. Occasionally he gets a few grains of wheat that have been
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: left on the ground by the reapers; but he does _no damage_. In
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: California, where the valley quail once were very numerous, they
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: sometimes consumed altogether too much wheat for the good of the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: farmers; but outside of California I believe such occurrences are
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: unknown.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Let us glance over the bob white's bill of fare:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: _Weed Seeds_.--One hundred and twenty-nine different weeds have been
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: found to contribute to the quail's bill of fare. Crops and stomachs have
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: been found crowded with rag-weed seeds, to the number of one thousand,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: while others had eaten as many seeds of crab-grass. A bird shot at Pine
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Brook, N.J., in October, 1902, had eaten five thousand seeds of green
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: fox-tail grass, and one killed on Christmas Day at Kinsale, Va., had
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: taken about ten thousand seeds of the pig-weed. (Elizabeth A. Reed.) In
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Bulletin No. 21, Biological Survey, it is calculated that if in Virginia
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and North Carolina there are four bob whites to every square mile, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: each bird consumes one ounce of seed per day, the total destruction to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: weed seeds from September 1st to April 30th in those states alone will
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: be 1,341 tons.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: In 1910 Mrs. Margaret Morse Nice, of Clark University, Worcester, Mass.,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: finished and contributed to the Journal of Economic Entomology (Vol.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: III., No. 3) a masterful investigation of "The Food of the Bob-White."
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: It should be in every library in this land. Mrs. Nice publishes the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: entire list of 129 species of weed seeds consumed by the quail,--and it
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: looks like a rogue's gallery. Here is an astounding record, which proves
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: once more that truth is stranger than fiction:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: NUMBER OF SEEDS EATEN BY A BOB-WHITE IN ONE DAY
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Barnyard grass    2,500       Milkweed                   770
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Beggar ticks      1,400       Peppergrass              2,400
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Black mustard     2,500       Pigweed                 12,000
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Burdock             600       Plantain                12,500
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Crab grass        2,000       Rabbitsfoot clover      30,000
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Curled dock       4,175       Round-headed bush clover 1,800
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Dodder            1,560       Smartweed                2,250
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Evening primrose 10,000       White vervain           18,750
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Lamb's quarter   15,000       Water smartweed          2,000
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: For the Smaller Pests of the Farm, This Bird is the Most
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Marvelous Engine of Destruction Ever put Together of Flesh and Blood.]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: _A few sample meals of insects_.--The following are records of single
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: individual meals of the bob white:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Of grasshoppers, 84; chinch bugs, 100; squash bugs, 12; army worm, 12;
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cut-worm, 12; mosquitoes, 568 in three hours; cotton boll weevil, 47;
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: flies, 1,350; rose slugs, 1,286. Miscellaneous insects consumed by a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: laying hen quail, 1,532, of which 1,000 were grasshoppers; total weigh
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of the lot, 24.6 grams.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: "F.M. Howard, of Beeville, Texas, wrote to the U.S. Bureau of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Entomology, that the bob whites shot in his vicinity had their crops
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: filled with the weevils. Another farmer reported his cotton fields full
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of quail, and an entire absence of weevils." Texas and Georgia papers
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: (please copy.)
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: And yet, because of its few pitiful ounces of flesh, two million gunners
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and ten thousand lawmakers think of the quail _only as a bird that can
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: be shot and eaten!_ Throughout a great portion of its former range,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: including New York and New Jersey, the species is surely and certainly
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: on the verge of _total extinction_. And yet sportsmen gravely discuss
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the "bag limit," and "enforcement of the bag-limit law" as a means of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: bringing back this almost vanished species! Such folly in grown men is
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: very trying.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: _To my friend, the Epicure_:--The next time you regale a good appetite
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: with blue points, terrapin stew, filet of sole and saddle of mutton,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: touched up here and there with the high lights of rare old sherry, rich
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: claret and dry monopole, pause as the dead quail is laid before you, on
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: a funeral pyre of toast, and consider this: "Here lies the charred
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: remains of the Farmer's Ally and Friend, poor Bob White. In life he
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: devoured 145 different kinds of bad insects, and the seeds of 129
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: anathema weeds. For the smaller pests of the farm, he was the most
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: marvelous engine of destruction that God ever put together of flesh and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: blood. He was good, beautiful and true; and his small life was
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: blameless. And here he lies, dead; snatched away from his field of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: labor, and destroyed, in order that I may be tempted to dine three
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: minutes longer, after I have already eaten to satiety."
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Then go on, and finish Bob White.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE CASE OF THE ROBIN.--For a long time this bird has been slaughtered
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: in the South for food, regardless of the agricultural interests of the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: North. No Southern gentleman ever shoots robins, or song birds of any
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: kind, but the negroes and poor whites do it. The worst case of recent
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: occurrence was the slaughter in the town of Pittsboro, North Carolina.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: It was in January, 1912. The Mayor of the town, Hon. Bennet Nooe, was
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: away from home; and during a heavy fall of snow "the robins came into
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the town in great numbers to feed upon the berries of the cedar trees.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: In order that the birds might be killed without restriction, the Board
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of Aldermen suspended the ordinance against the firing of guns in the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: town, and permitted the inhabitants to kill the robins."
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: A disgraceful carnival of slaughter immediately followed in which "about
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: all the male population" participated. Regarding this, Mayor Nooe later
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: on wrote to the editor of Bird Lore as follows:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: "Hearing of this, on my return, I went to the Aldermen, _all of whom
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: were guilty_, and told them that they and all others who were guilty
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: would have to be fined. Three out of the five submitted and paid up, but
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: they insisted that the ordinance be changed to read exactly as it is
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: written here, with the exception that _all could shoot_ robins in the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: town until the first of March; whereupon I resigned, as was
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: stated."--(_Bird Lore,_ XIV, 2. p. 140.)
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The Mayor was quite right. The robin butchers of Pittsboro were not
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: worthy to be governed by him.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE MEADOW LARK is one of the most valuable birds that frequent farming
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: regions. Throughout the year insects make up 73 per cent of its food,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: weed-seeds 12 per cent, and grain only 5 per cent. During the insect
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: season, insects constitute 90 per cent of its food.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE BALTIMORE ORIOLE is as valuable to man as it is beautiful. Its nest
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: is the most wonderful example of bird architecture in our land. In May
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: insects constitute 90 per cent of this bird's food. For the entire year,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: insects and other animal food make 83.4 per cent and vegetable matter
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: 16.6 per cent.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE CROW BLACKBIRD feeds as follows, throughout the whole year: insects,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: 26.9 per cent; other animal food 3.4; corn 37.2; oats, 2.9; wheat, 4.8;
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: other grain, 1.6; fruits, 5; weed seeds and mast 18.2! This report was
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: based on the examination (by the Biological Survey) of 2,346 stomachs,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and "the charge that the blackbird is an habitual robber of birds' nests
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: was disproved by the examinations." (F.E.L. Beal.)
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: FLYCATCHERS.--The high-water mark in insect-destruction by our birds is
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: reached by the flycatchers,--dull-colored, modest-mannered little
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: creatures that do their work so quietly you hardly notice them. All you
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: see in your tree-tops is a two-foot flit or glide, now here and now
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: there, as the leaves and high branches are combed of their insect life.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Bulletin No. 44 of the Department of Agriculture gives the residuum of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: an exhausting examination of 3,398 warbler stomachs, from seventeen
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: species of birds, and the result is: 94.99 per cent of insect
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: food,--mostly bad insects, too,--and 5.01 per cent vegetable food. What
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: more can any forester ask of a bird?
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: [Illustration: THE ROSE-BREASTED GROSBEAK
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: "The Potato-bug Bird," Greatest Enemy of the Potato Beetles
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: From the "American Natural History"]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE SPARROWS.--All our sparrows are great consumers of weed seeds.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Professor Beal has calculated the total quantity consumed in Iowa in one
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: year,--in the days when sparrows were normally numerous,--at 1,750,000
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: pounds.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE AMERICAN GOLDFINCH as a weed destroyer has few equals. It makes a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: specialty of the seeds of the members of the Order Compositae, and is
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: especially fond of the seeds of ragweed, thistles, wild lettuce and wild
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: sunflower. But, small and beautiful as this bird is, there are hundreds
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of thousands of grown men in America who would shoot it and eat it if
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: they dared!
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE HAWKS AND OWLS.--Let no other state repeat the error that once was
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: made in Pennsylvania when that state enacted in 1885, her now famous
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: hawk-and-owl bounty law. In order to accomplish the wholesale
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: destruction of her birds of prey, a law was passed providing for the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: payment of a bounty of fifty cents each for the scalps of hawks and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: owls. Immediately the slaughter began. In two years 180,000 scalps were
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: brought in, and $90,000 were paid out for them. It was estimated that
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the saving to the farmers in poultry amounted to one dollar for each
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: $1,205 paid out in bounties.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The awakening came even more swiftly than the ornithologists expected.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: By the end of two years from the passage of "the hawk law," the farmers
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: found their fields and orchards thoroughly overrun by destructive rats,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: mice and insects, and they appealed to the legislature for the quick
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: repeal of the law. With all possible haste this was brought about; but
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: it was estimated by competent judges that in damages to their crops the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: hawk law cost the people of Pennsylvania nothing less than two million
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: dollars.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Moral: Don't make any laws providing for the destruction of hawks and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: owls until you have exact knowledge, and know in advance what the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: results will be.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: In the space at my disposal for this subject, it is impossible to treat
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: our species of hawks and owls separately. The reader can find in the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: "American Natural History" fifteen pages of text, numerous illustrations
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and many figures elucidating this subject. Unfortunately Dr. Fisher's
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: admirable work on "The Hawks and Owls" has long been out of print, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: unobtainable. There are, however, a few observations that must be
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: recorded here.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Each bird of prey is a balanced equation. Each one, I think without a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: single exception, does _some_ damage, chiefly in the destruction of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: valuable wild birds. The value of the poultry destroyed by hawks and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: owls is very small in comparison with their killing of wild prey. _Many
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of the species do not touch domestic poultry_! At the same time, when a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: hawk of any kind, or an owl, sets to work deliberately and persistently
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to clean out a farmer's poultry yard, and is actually doing it, that
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: farmer is justified in killing that bird. But, the _occasional_ loss of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: a broiler is not to be regarded as justification for a war of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: extermination on _all_ the hawks that fly! Individual wild-animal
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: nuisances can occasionally become so exasperating as to justify the use
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of the gun,--when scarecrows fail; but in all such circumstances the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: greatest judgment, and much forbearance also, is desirable and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: necessary.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The value of hawks and owls rests upon their perpetual warfare on the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: millions of destructive rats, mice, moles, shrews, weasels, rabbits and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: English sparrows that constantly prey upon what the farmer produces. On
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: this point a few illustrations must be given. One of the most famous
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: comes via Dr. Fisher, from one of the towers of the Smithsonian
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: buildings, and relates to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE BARN OWL, (_Strix flammea_).--Two hundred pellets consisting of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: bones, hair and feathers from one nesting pair of these birds were
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: collected, and found to contain 454 skulls, of which 225 were of meadow
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: mice, 179 of house mice, 2 of pine mice, 20 were of rats, 6 of jumping
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: mice, 20 were from shrews, 1 was of a mole and 1 a vesper sparrow. _One_
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: bird, and 453 noxious mammals! Compare this with the record of any cat
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: on earth. Anything that the barn owl wants from me, or from any farmer,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: should at once be offered to it, on a silver tray. This bird is often
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: called the Monkey-Faced Owl, and it should be called the Farmer's-Friend
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Owl.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE LONG-EARED OWL, (_Asio wilsonianus_) has practically the same kind
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of a record as the barn owl,--scores of mice, rats and shrews
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: destroyed, and only an occasional small bird. Its nearest relative, the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: _Short-eared Owl (A. accipitrinus_) may be described in the same words.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: [Illustration: THE BARN OWL
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Wonderfully Destructive of Rats and Mice, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Almost Never Touches Birds]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The GREAT HORNED OWL fills us with conflicting passions. For the long
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: list of dead rats and mice, pocket gophers, skunks, and weasels to his
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: credit, we think well of him, and wish his prosperity. For the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: song-birds, ruffed grouse, quail, other game birds, domestic poultry,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: squirrels, chipmunks and hares that he kills, we hate him, and would
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cheerfully wring his neck, wearing gauntlets. He does an unusual amount
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of good, and a terrible amount of harm. It is impossible to strike a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: balance for him, and determine with mathematical accuracy whether he
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: should be shot or permitted to live. At all events, whenever _Bubo_
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: comes up for trial, we must give the feathered devil his due.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The names "CHICKEN HAWK or HEN HAWK" as applied usually refer to the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: RED-SHOULDERED or RED-TAILED species. Neither of these is really very
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: destructive to poultry, but both are very destructive to mice, rats and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: other pestiferous creatures. Both are large, showy birds, not so very
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: swift in flight, and rather easy to approach. Neither of them should be
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: destroyed,--not even though they do, once in a great while, take a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: chicken or wild bird. They pay for them, four times over, by
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: rat-killing. Mr. J. Alden Loring states that he once knew a pair of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: red-shouldered hawks to nest within fifty rods of a poultry farm on
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: which there were 800 young chickens and 400 ducks, not one of which was
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: taken. (See the American Natural History, pages 229-30.)
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: HAWKS THAT SHOULD BE DESTROYED.--There are two small, fierce, daring,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: swift-winged hawks both of which are so very destructive that they
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: deserve to be shot whenever possible. They are COOPER'S HAWK _(Accipiter
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cooperi_) and the SHARP-SHINNED HAWK _(A. velox_). They are closely
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: related, and look much alike, but the former has a rounded tail and the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: latter a square one. In killing them, _please do not kill any other hawk
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: by mistake_; and if you do not positively recognize the bird, don't
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: shoot.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE GOSHAWK is a bad one, and so is the PEREGRINE FALCON, or DUCK HAWK.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Both deserve death, but they are so rare that we need not take them into
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: account.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Some of the hawks and owls are very destructive to song-birds, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: members of the grouse family. In 159 stomachs of sharp-shinned hawks, 99
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: contained song-birds and woodpeckers. In 133 stomachs of Cooper's hawks,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: 34 contained poultry or game birds, and 52 contained other birds. The
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: game birds included 8 quail, 1 ruffed grouse and 5 pigeons.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE WOODPECKERS.[I]--These birds are the natural guardians of the trees.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: If we had enough of them, our forests would be fairly safe from insect
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: pests. Of the six or seven North American species that are of the most
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: importance to our forests, the DOWNY WOODPECKER, (_Dryobates pubescens_)
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: is accorded first rank. It is one of the smallest species. The contents
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of 140 stomachs consisted of 74 per cent insects, 25 per cent vegetable
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: matter and 1 per cent sand. The insects were ants, beetles, bugs, flies,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: caterpillars, grasshoppers and a few spiders.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: [Footnote I: The reader is advised to consult Prof. F.E.L. Beale's
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: admirable report on "The Food of Woodpeckers," Bulletin No. 7, U.S.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Department of Agriculture.]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE HAIRY WOODPECKER, (_Dryobates villosus_), a very close relation of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the preceding species, is also small, and his food supply is as follows:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: insects, 68 per cent, vegetable matter 31, mineral 1.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE GOLDEN-WINGED WOODPECKER, (_Colaptes auratus_), is the largest and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: handsomest of all the woodpeckers that we really see in evidence. The
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Pileated is one of the largest, but we never see it. This bird makes a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: specialty of ants, of which it devours immense numbers. Its food is 56
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: per cent animal matter (three-fourths of which is ants), 39 per cent is
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: vegetable matter, and 5 per cent mineral matter.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE RED-HEADED WOODPECKER is a serious fruit-eater, and many complaints
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: have been lodged against him. Exactly one-half his food supply consists
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of vegetable matter, chiefly wild berries, acorns, beechnuts, and the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: seeds of wild shrubs and weeds. We may infer that about one-tenth of his
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: food, in summer and fall, consists of cultivated fruit and berries. His
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: proportion of cultivated foods is entirely too small to justify any one
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: in destroying this species.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: In view of the prevalence of insect pests in the state of New York, I
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: have spent hours in trying to devise a practical plan for making
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: woodpeckers about ten times more numerous than they now are.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Contributions to this problem will be thankfully received. Yes; we _do_
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: put out pork fat and suet in winter, quantities of it; but I grieve to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: say that to-day in the Zoological Park there is not more than one
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: woodpecker for every ten that were there twelve years ago. Where have
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: they gone? Only one answer is possible. They have been shot and eaten,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: by the guerrillas of destruction.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: [Illustration: GOLDEN-WINGED WOODPECKER
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: A Bird of Great Value to Orchards and Forests, now
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Rapidly Disappearing, Undoubtedly Through Slaughter as "Food"]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Surely no man of intelligence needs to be told to protect woodpeckers to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the utmost, and to _feed them in winter_. Nail up fat pork, or large
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: chunks of suet, on the south sides of conspicuous trees, and encourage
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the woodpeckers, nuthatches, chickadees and titmice to remain in your
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: woods through the long and dreary winter.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE ENGLISH SPARROW is a nuisance and a pest, because it drives away
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: from the house and the orchard the house wren, bluebird, phoebe, purple
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: martin and swallow, any one of which is more valuable to man than a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: thousand English sparrows. I never yet have seen one of the pest
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: sparrows catch an insect, but Chief Forester Merkel says that he has
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: seen one catching and eating small moths.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: There is one place in the country where English sparrows have not yet
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: come; and whenever they do appear there, they will meet a hostile
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: reception. I shall kill every one that comes,--for the sake of retaining
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the wrens, catbirds, phoebes and thrushes that now literally make home
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: happy for my family. A good way to discourage sparrows is to shoot them
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: en masse when they are feeding on road refuse, such as the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: white-throated, white-crowned and other sparrows never touch. Persistent
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: destruction of their nests will check the nuisance.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: THE SHORE BIRDS.--Who is there who thinks of the shore-birds as being
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: directly beneficial to man by reason of their food habits? I warrant not
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: more than one man in every ten thousand! We think of them only as
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: possible "food." The amount of actual cash value benefit that the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: shore-birds confer upon man through the destruction of bad things is, in
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: comparison with the number of birds, enormous.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The Department of Agriculture never publishes and circulates anything
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: that has already been published, no matter how valuable to the public at
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: large. Our rules are different. Because I know that many of the people
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of our country need the information, I am going to reprint here, as an
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: object lesson and a warning, the whole of the Biological Survey's
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: valuable and timely circular No. 79, issued April 11, 1911, and written
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: by Prof. W.L. McAtee. It should open the eyes of the American people to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: two things: the economic value of these birds, and the fact that they
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: are everywhere far on the road toward extermination!
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: OUR VANISHING SHOREBIRDS
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: By Prof. W.L. McAtee
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The term shorebird is applied to a group of long-legged, slender-billed,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and usually plainly colored birds belonging to the order Limicolae. More
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: than sixty species of them occur in North America. True to their name
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: they frequent the shores of all bodies of water, large and small, but
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: many of them are equally at home on plains and prairies.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Throughout the eastern United States shorebirds are fast vanishing.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: While formerly numerous species swarmed along the Atlantic coast and in
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the prairie regions, many of them have been so reduced that
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: extermination seems imminent. The black-bellied plover or beetlehead,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: which occurred along the Atlantic seaboard in great numbers years ago,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: is now seen only as a straggler. The golden plover, once exceedingly
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: abundant east of the Great Plains, is now rare. Vast hordes of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: long-billed dowitchers formerly wintered in Louisiana; now they occur
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: only in infrequent flocks of a half dozen or less. The Eskimo curlew
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: within the last decade has probably been exterminated and the other
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: curlews greatly reduced. In fact, all the larger species of shorebirds
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: have suffered severely.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: So adverse to shorebirds are present conditions that the wonder is that
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: any escape. In both fall and spring they are shot along the whole route
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of their migration north and south. Their habit of decoying readily and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: persistently, coming back in flocks to the decoys again and again, in
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: spite of murderous volleys, greatly lessens their chances of escape.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The breeding grounds of some of the species in the United States and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Canada have become greatly restricted by the extension of agriculture,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and their winter ranges in South America have probably been restricted
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: in the same way.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Unfortunately, shorebirds lay fewer eggs than any of the other species
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: generally termed game birds. They deposit only three or four eggs, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: hatch only one brood yearly. Nor are they in any wise immune from the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: great mortality known to prevail among the smaller birds. Their eggs and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: young are constantly preyed upon during the breeding season by crows,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: gulls, and jaegers, and the far northern country to which so many of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: them resort to nest is subject to sudden cold storms, which kill many of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the young. In the more temperate climate of the United States small
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: birds, in general, do not bring up more than one young bird for every
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: two eggs laid. Sometimes the proportion of loss is much greater, actual
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: count revealing a destruction of 70 to 80 per cent of nests and eggs.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Shorebirds, with sets of three or four eggs, probably do not on the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: average rear more than two young for each breeding pair.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: It is not surprising, therefore, that birds of this family, with their
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: limited powers of reproduction, melt away under the relentless warfare
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: waged upon them. Until recent years shorebirds have had almost no
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: protection. Thus, the species most in need of stringent protection have
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: really had the least. No useful birds which lay only three or four eggs
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: should be retained on the list of game birds. The shorebirds should be
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: relieved from persecution, and if we desire to save from extermination a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: majority of the species, action must be prompt.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The protection of shorebirds need not be based solely on esthetic or
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: sentimental grounds, for few groups of birds more thoroughly deserve
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: protection from an economic standpoint. Shorebirds perform an important
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: service by their inroads upon mosquitoes, some of which play so
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: conspicuous a part in the dissemination of diseases. Thus, nine species
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: are known to feed upon mosquitoes, and hundreds of the larvae or
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: "wigglers" were found in several stomachs. Fifty-three per cent of the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: food of twenty-eight northern phalaropes from one locality consisted of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: mosquito larvae. The insects eaten include the salt-marsh mosquito
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: (_Aedes sollicitans_), for the suppression of which the State of New
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Jersey has gone to great expense. The nine species of shorebirds known
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to eat mosquitoes are:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Northern phalarope (_Lobipes lobatus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Semipalmated sandpiper (_Ereunetes pusillus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Wilson phalarope (_Steganopus tricolor_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Stilt sandpiper (_Micropalama himantopus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Killdeer (_Oxyechus vociferus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Pectoral sandpiper (_Pisobia maculata_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Semipalmated plover (_Aegialitis semipalmata_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Baird sandpiper (_Pisobia bairdi_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Least sandpiper (_Pisobia minutilla_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Cattle and other live stock also are seriously molested by mosquitoes as
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: well as by another set of pests, the horse-flies. Adults and larvae of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: these flies have been found in the stomachs of the dowitcher, the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: pectoral sandpiper, the hudsonian godwit, and the killdeer. Two species
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of shorebirds, the killdeer and upland plover, still further befriend
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cattle by devouring the North American fever tick.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Among other fly larvae consumed are those of the crane flies
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: (leather-jackets) devoured by the following species:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Northern phalarope (_Lobipes lobatus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Pectoral sandpiper (_Pisobia maculata_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Wilson phalarope (_Steganopus tricolor_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Baird sandpiper (_Pisobia bairdi_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Woodcock (_Philohela minor_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Upland plover (_Bartramia longicauda_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Jacksnipe (_Gallinago delicata_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Killdeer (_Oxyechus vociferus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Crane-fly larvae are frequently seriously destructive locally in grass
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and wheat fields. Among their numerous bird enemies, shorebirds rank
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: high.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Another group of insects of which the shorebirds are very fond is
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: grasshoppers. Severe local infestations of grasshoppers, frequently
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: involving the destruction of many acres of corn, cotton, and other
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: crops, are by no means exceptional. Aughey found twenty-three species
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of shorebirds feeding on Rocky Mountain locusts in Nebraska, some of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: them consuming large numbers, as shown below.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: 9 killdeer stomachs contained an average of 28 locusts each.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: 11 semipalmated plover stomachs contained an average of 38 locusts each.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: 16 mountain plover stomachs contained an average of 45 locusts each.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: 11 jacksnipe stomachs contained an average of 37 locusts each.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: 22 upland plover stomachs contained an average of 36 locusts each.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: 10 long-billed curlew stomachs contained an average of 48 locusts each.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: [Illustration: TWO MEMBERS OF THE GROUP OF SHORE-BIRDS
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The Killdeer Plover     The Jacksnipe
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: These, with 28 other species, destroy enormous numbers of locusts,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: grasshoppers, crane-fly larvae, mosquito larvae, army-worms, cut-worms,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cotton-worms, boll-weevils, curculios, wire-worms and clover-leaf
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: weevils. It is insane folly to shoot any birds that do such work! Many
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: species of the shore-birds are rapidly being exterminated.]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Even under ordinary conditions grasshoppers are a staple food of many
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: members of the shorebird family, and the following species are known to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: feed on them:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Northern phalarope (_Lobipes lobatus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Avocet (_Recurvirostra americana_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Black-necked stilt (_Himantopus mexicanus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Woodcock (_Philohela minor_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Jacksnipe (_Gallinago delicata_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Dowitcher (_Macrorhamphus griseus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Robin snipe (_Tringa canutus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: White-rumped sandpiper (_Pisobia fuscicollis_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Baird sandpiper (_Pisobia bairdi_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Least sandpiper (_Pisobia minutilla_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Buff-breasted sandpiper (_Tryngites subruficollis_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Spotted sandpiper (_Actitis macularia_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Long-billed curlew (_Numenius americanus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Black-bellied plover (_Squatarola squatarola_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Golden plover (_Charadrius dominicus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Killdeer (_Oxyechus vociferus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Semipalmated plover (_Aegialitis semipalmata_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Marbled godwit _(Limosa fedoa)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Ringed plover _(Aegialitis hiaticula)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Yellowlegs _(Totanus flavipes)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Mountain plover _(Podasocys montanus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Solitary sandpiper _(Helodromas solitarius)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Turnstone _(Arenaria interpres)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Upland plover _(Bartramia longicauda)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Shorebirds are fond of other insect pests of forage and grain crops,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: including the army worm, which is known to be eaten by the killdeer and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: spotted sandpiper; also cutworms, among whose enemies are the avocet,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: woodcock, pectoral and Baird sandpipers, upland plover, and killdeer.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Two caterpillar enemies of cotton, the cotton worm and the cotton
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cutworm, are eaten by the upland plover and killdeer. The latter bird
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: feeds also on caterpillars of the genus _Phlegethontius_, which
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: includes, the tobacco and tomato worms.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The principal farm crops have many destructive beetle enemies also, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: some of these are eagerly eaten by shorebirds. The boll weevil and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: clover-leaf weevil are eaten by the upland plover and killdeer, the rice
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: weevil by the killdeer, the cowpea weevil by the upland plover, and the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: clover-root curculio by the following species of shorebirds:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Northern phalarope _(Lobipes lobatus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: White-rumped sandpiper _(Pisobia fuscicollis)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Pectoral sandpiper _(Pisobia maculata_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Upland plover _(Bartramia longicauda)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Baird sandpiper _(Pisobia bairdi)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Killdeer _(Oxyechus vociferus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The last two eat also other weevils which attack cotton, grapes and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: sugar beets. Bill-bugs, which often do considerable damage to corn, seem
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: to be favorite food of some of the shorebirds. They are eaten by the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Wilson phalarope, avocet, black-necked stilt, pectoral sandpiper,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: killdeer, and upland plover. They are an important element of the latter
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: bird's diet, and no fewer than eight species of them have been found in
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: its food.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Wireworms and their adult forms, click beetles, are devoured by the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: northern phalarope, woodcock, jacksnipe, pectoral sandpiper, killdeer,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and upland plover. The last three feed also on the southern corn
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: leaf-beetle and the last two upon the grapevine colaspis. Other
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: shorebirds that eat leaf-beetles are the Wilson phalarope and dowitcher.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Crayfishes, which are a pest in rice and corn fields in the South and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: which injure levees, are favorite food of the black-necked stilt, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: several other shorebirds feed upon them, notably the jacksnipe, robin
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: snipe, spotted sandpiper, upland plover, and killdeer.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Thus it is evident that shorebirds render important aid by devouring the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: enemies of farm crops and in other ways, and their services are
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: appreciated by those who have observed the birds in the field. Thus W.A.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Clark, of Corpus Christi, Tex., reports that upland plovers are
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: industrious in following the plow and in eating the grubs that destroy
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: garden stuff, corn, and cotton crops. H.W. Tinkham, of Fall River,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Mass., says of the spotted sandpiper: "Three pairs nested in a young
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: orchard behind my house and adjacent to my garden. I did not see them
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: once go to the shore for food (shore about 1,500 feet away), but I did
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: see them many times make faithful search of my garden for cutworms,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: spotted squash bugs, and green flies. Cutworms and cabbage worms were
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: their special prey. After the young could fly, they still kept at work
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: in my garden, and showed no inclination to go to the shore until about
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: August 15th. They and a flock of quails just over the wall helped me
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: wonderfully."
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: In the uncultivated parts of their range also, shorebirds search out and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: destroy many creatures that are detrimental to man's interest. Several
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: species prey upon the predaceous diving beetles _(Dytiscidae),_ which
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: are a nuisance in fish hatcheries and which destroy many insects, the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: natural food of fishes. The birds now known to take these beetles are:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Northern phalarope _(Lobipes lobatus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Dowitcher _(Macrorhamphus griseus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Wilson phalarope _(Steganopus tricolor)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Robin snipe _(Tringa canutus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Avocet _(Recurvirostra americana)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Pectoral sandpiper _(Pisobia maculata)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Black-necked stilt _(Himantopus mexicanus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Red-backed sandpiper _(Pelidna alpina sakhalina)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Jacksnipe _(Gallinago delicata)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Kill deer _(Oxyechus vociferus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Large numbers of marine worms of the genus _Nereis_, which prey upon
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: oysters, are eaten by shorebirds. These worms are common on both the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Atlantic and Gulf coasts and are eaten by shorebirds wherever they
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: occur. It is not uncommon to find that from 100 to 250 of them have been
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: eaten at one meal. The birds known to feed upon them are:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Northern phalarope _(Lobipes lobatus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: White-rumped sandpiper _(Pisobia fuscicollis)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Dowitcher _(Macrorhamphus griseus_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Stilt sandpiper _(Micropalama himantopus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Red-backed sandpiper _(Pelidna alpina sakhalina)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Robin snipe _(Tringa canutus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Purple sandpiper _(Arquatella maritima_).
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Killdeer _(Oxyechus vociferus)_.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The economic record of the shorebirds deserves nothing but praise. These
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: birds injure no crop, but on the contrary feed upon many of the worst
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: enemies of agriculture. It is worth recalling that their diet includes
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: such pests as the Rocky Mountain locust and other injurious
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: grasshoppers, the army worm, cutworms, cabbage worms, cotton worm,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cotton cutworm, boll weevil, clover leaf weevil, clover root curculio,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: rice weevil, corn bill-bugs, wireworms, corn leaf-beetles, cucumber
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: beetles, white grubs, and such foes of stock as the Texas fever tick,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: horseflies, and mosquitoes. Their warfare on crayfishes must not be
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: overlooked, nor must we forget the more personal debt of gratitude we
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: owe them for preying upon mosquitoes. They are the most important bird
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: enemies of these pests known to us.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Shorebirds have been hunted until only a remnant of their once vast
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: numbers is left. Their limited powers of reproduction, coupled with the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: natural vicissitudes of the breeding period, make their increase slow,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and peculiarly expose them to danger of extermination.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: In the way of protection a beginning has been made, and a continuous
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: close season until 1915 has been established for the following birds:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The killdeer, in Massachusetts and Louisiana; the upland plover, in
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Massachusetts, and Vermont; and the piping plover in Massachusetts. But,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: considering the needs and value of these birds, this modicum of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: protection is small indeed.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The above-named species are not the only ones that should be exempt
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: from persecution, for all the shorebirds of the United States are in
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: great need of better protection. They should be protected, first, to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: save them from the danger of extermination, and, second, because of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: their economic importance. So great, indeed, is their economic value,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: that their retention on the game list and their destruction by sportsmen
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: is a serious loss to agriculture.--(End of the circular.)
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The following appeared in the _Zoological Society Bulletin_, for
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: January, 1909, from Richard Walter Tomalin, of Sydney, N.S.W.:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: "In the subdistricts of Robertson and Kangaloon in the Illawarra
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: district of New South Wales, what ten years ago was a waving mass of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: English cocksfoot and rye grass, which had been put in gradually as the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: dense vine scrub was felled and burnt off, is now a barren desert, and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: nine families out of every ten which were renting properties have been
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: compelled to leave the district and take up other lands. This is through
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the grubs having eaten out the grass by the roots. Ploughing proved to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: be useless, as the grubs ate out the grass just the same. Whilst there
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: recently I was informed that it took three years from the time the grubs
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: were first seen until to-day, to accomplish this complete devastation;.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: in other words, three years ago the grubs began work in the beautiful
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: country of green mountains and running streams.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: "The birds had all been ruthlessly shot and destroyed in that district,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and I was amazed at the absence of bird life. The two sub-districts I
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: have mentioned have an area of about thirty square miles, and form a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: table-land about 1200 feet above sea level."
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The same kind of common sense that teaches men to go in when it rains,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and keep out of fiery furnaces, teaches us that as a business
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: proposition it is to man's interest to protect the birds. Make them
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: plentiful and keep them so. When we strike the birds, we hurt ourselves.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The protection of our insect-eating and seed-eating birds is a cash
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: proposition,--protect or pay.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Were I a farmer, no gun ever should be fired on my premises at any bird
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: save the English sparrow and the three bad hawks. Any man who would kill
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: my friend Bob White I would treat as an enemy. The man who would shoot
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and eat any of the song-birds, woodpeckers, or shorebirds that worked
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: for me, I would surely molest.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: _Every farmer should post every foot of his lands, cultivated and not
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: cultivated_. The farmer who does not do so is his own enemy; and he
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: needs a guardian.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: At this stage of wild life extermination, it is impossible to make our
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: bird-protection laws too strict, or too far-reaching. The remnant of our
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: birds should be protected, with clubs and guns if necessary. All our
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: shore birds should be accorded a ten-year close season. Don't ask the
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: gunners whether they will _agree_ to it or not. _Of course they will not
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: agree to it,--never_! But our duty is clear,--to go ahead and _do it_!
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: CHAPTER XXIV
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: GAME AND AGRICULTURE; AND DEER AS A FOOD SUPPLY
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: As a state and county asset, the white-tailed deer contains
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: possibilities that as yet seem to be ignored by the American people as a
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: whole. It is quite time to consider that persistent, prolific and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: toothsome animal.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The proposition that large herds of horned game can not becomingly roam
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: at will over farms and vineyards worth one hundred dollars per acre,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: affords little room for argument. Generally speaking, there is but one
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: country in the world that breaks this well-nigh universal rule; and that
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: country is India. On the plains between and adjacent to the Ganges and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the Jumna, for two thousand years herds of black-buck, or sasin
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: antelope, have roamed over cultivated fields so thickly garnished with
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: human beings that to-day the rifle-shooting sportsman stands in hourly
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: peril of bagging a five-hundred-rupee native every time he fires at an
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: antelope.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Wherever rich agricultural lands exist, the big game must give
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: way,--_from those lands_. To-day the bison could not survive in Iowa,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: eastern Nebraska or eastern Kansas, any longer than a Shawnee Indian
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: would last on the Bowery. It was foredoomed that the elk, deer, bear and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: wild turkey should vanish from the rich farming regions of the East and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the middle West.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: To-day in British East Africa lions are being hunted with dogs and shot
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: wholesale, because they are a pest to the settlers and to the surviving
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: herds of big game. At the same time, the settlers who are striving to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: wrest the fertile plains of B.E.A, from the domain of savagery declare
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: that the African buffalo, the zebra, the kongoni and the elephant are
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: public nuisances that must be suppressed by the rifle.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Even the most ardent friend of wild life must admit that when a settler
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: has laboriously fenced his fields, and plowed and sowed, only to have
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: his whole crop ruined in one night by a herd of fence-breaking zebras,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the event is sufficient to abrade the nerves of the party most in
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: interest. While I take no stock in stories of dozens of "rogue"
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: elephants that require treatment with the rifle, and of grown men being
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: imperiled by savage gazelles, we admit that there are times when wild
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: animals can make nuisances of themselves. Let us consider that subject
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: now.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: WILD ANIMAL NUISANCES.--Complaints have come to me, at various times, of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: great destruction of lambs by eagles; of trout by blue herons; of crops
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: (on Long Island) by deer; of pears destroyed by birds, and of valuable
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: park trees by beavers that chop down trees not wisely but too well. I do
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: not, however, include in this category any cherries eaten by robins, or
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: orioles, or jays; for they are of too small importance to consider in
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: this court.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: [Illustration: A FOOD SUPPLY OF WHITE-TAILED DEER
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: The Killing of the Does was Wrong]
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: To meet the legitimate demands for the abatement of unbearable
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: wild-animal nuisances, I recommend the enactment of a law similar to
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Section 158 of the Game laws of New York, which provides for the safe
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and legitimate abatement of unbearable wild creatures as follows:
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: Section 158. _Power to Take Birds and Quadrupeds_. In the event that
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: any species of birds protected by the provisions of section two
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: hundred and nineteen of this article, or quadrupeds protected by
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: law, shall at any time, in any locality, become destructive of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: private or public property, the commission shall have power in its
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: discretion to direct any game protector, or issue a permit to any
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: citizen of the state, to take such species of birds or quadrupeds
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: and dispose of the same in such manner as the commission may
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: provide. Such permit shall expire within four months after the date
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of issuance.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: This measure should be adopted by every state that is troubled by too
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: many, or too aggressive, wild mammals or birds.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: But to return to the subject of big game and farming. We do not complain
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: of the disappearance of the bison, elk, deer and bear from the farms of
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: the United States and Canada. The passing of the big game from all such
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: regions follows the advance of real civilization, just so surely and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: certainly as night follows day.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: But this vast land of ours is not wholly composed of rich agricultural
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: lands; not by any means. There are millions of acres of forest lands,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: good, bad and indifferent, worth from nothing per acre up to one hundred
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: dollars or more. There are millions of acres of rocky, brush-covered
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: mountains and hills, wholly unsuited to agriculture, or even
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: horticulture. There are other millions of acres of arid plains and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: arboreal deserts, on which nothing but thirst-proof animals can live and
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: thrive. The South contains vast pine forests and cypress swamps,
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: millions of acres of them, of which the average northerner knows less
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: than nothing.
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: We can not stop long enough to look it up, but from the green color on
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: our national map that betokens the forest reserves, and from our own
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life

txt: personal knowledge of the deserts, swamps, barrens and rocks that we
name: Our Vanishing Wild Life
